intro: Zexmenia stenantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved zexmenia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
